instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVTTDDR_S3: What is PPVTTDDR_S3? PPVTTDDR_S3 is a 3.3v power rail that powers the DDR RAM when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state. .
definitions.DDRREG_EN: What is DDRREG_EN? DDRREG_EN is an enable signal that turns on power rails for DDR memory.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps
threads.message:
Hi I got yet another board that does 3 beeps

I missing <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> missing 19&20 But it seems I have all other signals.
with ram installed Smbus is good I have 1 beep with ram removed. All measurements with ram installed 12800& 10666 tested with both

1-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_VTTSNS</SIGNAL>=.75
2-<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL>=1.5v
3-<SIGNAL>PP075_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL>=.75
4-GND=0v
5-<SIGNAL>PPVTTDDR_S3</SIGNAL>=.75V
6-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_1V8_VREF</SIGNAL>=1.8v
7-GND_-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_SGND</SIGNAL>=0v
8-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_FB</SIGNAL>=1.5v
9-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_VDDQSNS</SIGNAL>=1.5v
10-GND
11-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_DRVL</SIGNAL>=driver frequency
12-PP5vS3=5v
13-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_LL</SIGNAL>=drive frequency
14-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_DRVH</SIGNAL>=driver Freuency
15-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_VBST</SIGNAL>=5.33v
16-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_EN</SIGNAL>=3.3v
17-<SIGNAL>MEMVTT_EN</SIGNAL>=3.3v
18-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_TRIP</SIGNAL>=.75
19-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_MODE</SIGNAL>=0v
20-<SIGNAL>DDRREG_PGOOD</SIGNAL>=0v

I check all of <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q3205</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q3210</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q3215</TRANSISTOR>
The only one that stood out as odd is <SIGNAL>ISOLATE_CPU_MEM_L</SIGNAL>= 2.5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps
threads.message:
Did you check each DDR slot by separate?
3 beeps on both ports?
Do you have DDR3 test card?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps
threads.message:
Yes I tested each slot individually both have same issue 1beep with out ram stick and 3 beeps with ram installed 
 Both ram slots pass ram with DDR test card. All DDR test  card illuminate

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps
threads.message: If connections are good, then can be CPU issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps
threads.message:
Do you think it’s worth checking CLKE0, CLKE1 or DMI connections for some sort of
Signals or wave forms ? Or just call it quits ? Also thank you for your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps
threads.message:
If the LEDs patron is correct, then traces and solders are good (to CPU).
You've already posted good voltages for RAM, so internal CPU issue is expected now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps
threads.message: Ok thank you 2informatico. May I ask one more question. Would it be better to invest in a ultrasonic or a bga machines? I have purchased at least 6 boards that either have pch or cpu issues. It’s more about trying to rescue what you can. Is it a wise investment ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps
threads.message:
Replacing BGA CPU is not easy job.
You need good skills and lot of practice to replace PCH, or GPU in Apple boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps
threads.message: There is a way to align that chips? theres no mark on board. thanks in advance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps
threads.message:
Must scratch around the chip before remove it.
Carefully, not damaging any trace...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps
threads.message: Niiice tip.. noob of me XD... thanks
